title: Toulouse bike route
name: Toulouse bike route
description:
A Map by Chrisrust

How to get from Toulouse airport to Toulouse railway station by bicycle

properties.name: Bear right
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustFollow the road round to the right on to the Boulevard d\'Arcole

properties.name: Buy Camping Gaz
properties.description: Posted by Chrisrust  No 7 Rue de Bayard is a hardware shop, Bric \'Elec Bayard, that sells camping Gaz. I had my camping stove but did not take gas on the aircraft so I needed to stock up. If you use the other kind of gas cylinder (Coleman etc) you will need to come prepared with an adaptor so your stove will take French Camping Gaz cartridges, the French are very patriotic so they don\'t have those foreign types, but the French Camping Gaz stoves are no good for lightweight camping. French campers all travel by Renault Espace and carry massive amounts of culinary and sporting equipment, they don\'t transport things by bicycle.

properties.name: End of the riverside path
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustThe path is blocked by the bridge, turn down to your left on to the road that circles round under the main road. It is the old Velodrome from the days when cycle racing was a public spectacle. Turn right through the underpass under the main road.

properties.name: Gare Matabiau
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustYou have arrived. Warning - this is a big station and very busy, despite all you have heard about the wonderful French Railways the wonderfulness does not extend to customer service. The queus for the ticket office were impossibly long and there were two SNCF self-service ticket machines with relatively short queues but the machines appeared to be do slow and difficult to use that people were taking up to ten minutes each to buy a ticket. But I found a secret weapon, a ticket machine operated by the TER regional railways close to the access to the platforms. This worked very well, but I advise you to hang around for a few minutes and watch a local operating it first as there is a quirky rotating dial to operate the menus. Once you have the idea, it\'s easy, even with my minimal French language I was able to use it and buy a ticket with my UK debit card. The only problem after that is, when you find which platform your train goes from, you discover that information services are very badly run, there are electronic signs which seem to tell you what you want to know but the reality is that people mill around and rush from one empty train to another with confused station staff and even the train driver not knowing which train is going to depart. But there is good cycle space on the TER trains and the modern little ones that go into the mountains are comfortable with low floor access (Other French trains are designed for mountaineers who like very steep steps)

properties.name: Keep Going
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustKeep on the riverside path

properties.name: Keep Going this way
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustNearly there

properties.name: Keep going along the riverside path
properties.description: Posted by Chrisrust

properties.name: Keep straight on along the Chemin de Belisaire
properties.description: Posted by Chrisrust

properties.name: Shop Here
properties.description: Posted by Chrisrust If, like me, you have just arrived off the plane, and you need supplies, there is a small supermarket here where you can buy water snacks etc.

properties.name: Start here
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustAs you come out of the airport the turning is a very small road on the right, just looks like a little service route

properties.name: Straight across
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustThe station (Gare Matabiau) is right in front of you

properties.name: Turn Left
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustTurn left and cross the Pont de Blagnac, a very pleasant bridge with not much traffic when I was there

properties.name: Turn Left
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustOn to Rue de Guyenne

properties.name: Turn Left
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustInto Rue Bayard

properties.name: Turn Right
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustStraight over Rue de Grenade and turn right into Chemin des Soeurs

properties.name: Turn Right
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustTurn onto the Avenue du Parc, there is a cycle track alongside the main road

properties.name: Turn Right
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustOn to Avenue du General Compans. I\'ve not used this bit as there were road works that diverted me on to Avenue du 11 Novembre 1918 and I was a bit lost for a while, but the main route looks pretty straightforward

properties.name: Turn Right on to the main road
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustTurn on to the Avenue Paul SeJourne, It\'s a busy road with a narrow cycle lane at the side, you need to be confident here, position yourself where you can be seen and remember that there are a lot of cyclists in Toulouse and French drivers respect cyclists.

properties.name: Turn Right onto riverside path
properties.description: Posted by ChrisrustImmediately you reach the far side of the bridge there is a footpath along the riverbank to the right, It provides a fast traffic free route along a high embankment with good views on both sides.

properties.name: Turn left
properties.description: Posted by Chrisrust
